question.title: SplitPane ignores divider positions when adding a new item with ResizableWithParent = false
question.body:
I have a SplitPane where I want only one item to be ResizableWithParent = true, while all other items should not be resizable with the parent.

The problem is that when I add a new item and then set the divider positions, the SplitPane seems to ignore my specified positions.

This is my code:

public class TestFx extends Application {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        launch(args);
    }

    private final SplitPane splitPane = new SplitPane();

    @Override
    public void start(Stage primaryStage) {
        splitPane.getItems().add(createItem(0));
        splitPane.setOrientation(Orientation.VERTICAL);
        VBox.setVgrow(splitPane, Priority.ALWAYS);
        var fooPane = new Pane(new Label("Foo pane"));
        VBox.setVgrow(fooPane, Priority.ALWAYS);

        var button = new Button("Test");
        button.setOnAction(e -> {
            splitPane.getItems().add(createItem(1));
            splitPane.setDividerPositions(new double[]{0.5});
            printDividerPositions("Current pulse: ");
            Platform.runLater(() -> printDividerPositions("2nd pulse: "));
            Platform.runLater(() -> Platform.runLater(() -> printDividerPositions("3rd pulse: ")));
        });

        var root = new VBox(splitPane, fooPane, button);
        Scene scene = new Scene(root, 500, 300);
        primaryStage.setScene(scene);
        primaryStage.show();
    }

    private void printDividerPositions(String pulseInfo) {
        System.out.println(pulseInfo + Arrays.toString(splitPane.getDividerPositions()));
    }

    private Pane createItem(int index) {
        var pane = new Pane(new Label("Item : " + index));
        if (index == 0) {
            SplitPane.setResizableWithParent(pane, true);
        } else {
            SplitPane.setResizableWithParent(pane, false);
        }
        return pane;
    }
}

And this is the output:

Current pulse: [0.5]
2nd pulse: [0.5]
3rd pulse: [0.9797297297297297]

As you can see, my divider positions were overridden by the SplitPane. Could anyone explain how to fix this, if it’s not a bug?

question_comments.body: I understand now. This looks like a bug; the split pane should respect calls to setDividerPositions(...) regardless (as it does for user dragging gestures on the dividers). The only difference should be in the way it allocates space if the dimensions of the split pane itself (or, perhaps more accurately, the amount of space available to the split pane's items) change.

@James_D In my interpretation resizableWithParent means, that if the parent size changes then item size changes too. For my real application this is disabled, so, for example, when user minimizes/maximizes the window the item size is the same.

Isn't this the expected outcome? My interpretation of SplitPane.setResizableWithParent(pane, false) is that pane will be sized to its preferred size (adjusting the dividers accordingly) instead of being sized by the SplitPane (and specifically by the divider positions). Since your pane has no child nodes its preferred size is 0. But maybe this is not the correct interpretation. What are you expecting the calls to setResizableWithParent(...) to do?
I don’t even see the new Pane when I press the button. Try changing both occurrences of new Pane to new BorderPane.
